page.title: 15Religious Events
page.content: In 1978 the ancient tradition of holding the{Rogationtide Procession} was restored.The procession stops at various points to bless a farm or garden.More recently this has been extended to a walk around the whole of the United Benefice,for a service in each of the five churches in turn.Another custom revived is the {Harvest Supper}which traditionally was held by each farmer in his biggest barn,but is now held in the Village Hall for the whole community. The centenary of St.Lawrence's church has been celebrated with various events during the year including a{flower festival,fete,clay {pigeon shoot and a musical evening.}At the{Centenary Day Communion Service} 100 replicas of the St.Lawrence cross on a griddle,symbolising his fiery death,were distributed.
